item.title: 在特朗普对欧洲的贸易战中，中国赢了
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普在 10 月份接受彭博新闻社主编约翰-米克尔斯韦特（John Micklethwait）采访时被问及，如果华盛顿加强对欧洲的贸易保护，那么美国对中国的地缘政治地位就有可能受到损害。【原文：Donald Trump, in an October interview with Bloomberg News Editor-in-Chief John Micklethwait, was asked about the risk of undermining America’s geopolitical position vis-à-vis China if Washington ramped up trade protections against Europe.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长帕内塔称无需暂缓降息
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员法比奥-帕内塔（Fabio Panetta）表示，由于2%的物价目标已近在眼前，且通胀风险偏向下行，因此没有必要暂缓降息。【原文：There’s no need to hold back on European Central Bank interest rate cuts as the 2% price target is in sight and inflation risks are to the downside, Governing Council member Fabio Panetta said.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：美国通胀率在关税前回升
item.description: 今年年初，美国通胀率普遍回升，进一步降低了美联储很快降息的可能性。【原文：US inflation picked up broadly at the start of the year, further diminishing chances the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates anytime soon.】

item.title: 帕内塔称 M&A 将为贷款人提供规模：意大利银行最新消息
item.description: 意大利的银行家们正在都灵举行的年度Assiom外汇会议上讨论他们行业的未来，该行业受到了整合浪潮的冲击，因为贷款人正在寻求调配过剩资本，并在利率准备下降的情况下实现收入多样化。【原文：Bankers in Italy are meeting at the annual Assiom Forex conference in Turin to discuss the future of their industry, which has been hit by a wave of consolidation, as lenders are seeking to deploy excess capital and diversify revenue with interest rates poised to fall.】

item.title: 肖尔茨给德国人留下了一代人中最糟糕的经济忧郁症
item.description: 奥拉夫-肖尔茨正在走向德国历任总理中最惨痛的选举失败，而他糟糕的经济记录是一个重要原因。【原文：Olaf Scholz is heading for the worst election defeat of any German chancellor, and his poor economic track record is one major reason.】

item.title: 财富基金主管称，对风险的厌恶阻碍了英国的发展
item.description: 英国在风险方面存在问题；国家承担的风险不足。【原文：Britain has a problem with risk — the country does not take enough of it.】

item.title: 加纳总统称美国冻结援助使其软实力受损
item.description: 加纳总统约翰-马哈马说，美国冻结国际援助的决定很可能会给世界最大经济体带来 "反作用"。【原文：The US’s decision to freeze international aid will likely cause “blowback” for the world’s largest economy, Ghana’s President John Mahama said.】

item.title: 美国寻求通过交易拥有乌克兰 50%的稀土矿产：美国全国广播公司（NBC
item.description: 据美国全国广播公司（NBC）报道，作为两国伙伴关系协议的一部分，美国正在向乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）提交一份提案，寻求拥有乌克兰 50%的稀土矿。【原文：The US is seeking to own 50% of Ukraine’s rare earth minerals in a proposal presented to President Volodymyr Zelenskiy as part of a partnership accord between the two countries, NBC reported.】

item.title: 米莱推加密代币，后因担心受骗删帖
item.description: 哈维尔-米莱伊总统为一种旨在帮助阿根廷当地企业的加密代币做了广告，但他的支持引起了人们对潜在骗局的广泛担忧，于是他删除了帖子。【原文：President Javier Milei advertised a crypto token meant to help local Argentine businesses, but his support was met with widespread concern about a potential scam and he deleted the post.】

item.title: Spotify 考虑收取 6 美元的高级会员费以增加功能和获取门票
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，Spotify Technology SA 正寻求在现有订购服务的基础上，为一项新的超级粉丝流媒体服务收取高达 5.99 美元的月费，该服务将包括更高质量的音频、混音工具和音乐会门票。【原文：Spotify Technology SA is looking to charge as much as $5.99 a month on top of existing subscriptions for a new super-fan streaming service that will include higher-quality audio, remixing tools and access to concert tickets, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 飓风减弱后澳大利亚铁矿石出口枢纽将重新开放
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的铁矿石港口预计将在周六晚些时候重新开放，因为它没有受到强烈热带气旋 "泽利亚 "的严重破坏。【原文：Australia’s biggest iron ore port is expected to reopen later Saturday after being spared any major damage from Severe Tropical Cyclone Zelia.】

item.title: 鲁比奥与菲律宾总统马纳洛讨论南海协调问题
item.description: 据美国国务院称，美国国务卿马尔科-鲁比奥（Marco Rubio）和菲律宾国务卿恩里克-马纳洛（Enrique Manalo）周五在慕尼黑举行的会晤中讨论了 "协调应对中国在南中国海破坏稳定的行动 "和加强经济合作的问题。【原文：US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and his Philippine counterpart, Enrique Manalo, discussed “coordination on addressing China’s destabilizing actions in the South China Sea” and increased economic cooperation in a meeting in Munich on Friday, according to the US State Department.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体亏损激增，向员工出售 1.07 亿美元股票
item.description: Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. 去年在收入下降、亏损 4.01 亿美元的情况下，奖励员工超过 1.07 亿美元的股票。【原文：Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. rewarded employees with more than $107 million in stock last year as revenue declined and it posted a $401 million loss.】

item.title: Anthropic 称美国谷歌搜索建议将损害人工智能投资
item.description: 人工智能开发商Anthropic要求联邦法院否决美国政府的一项提案，该提案将阻止Alphabet公司旗下的谷歌投资人工智能初创企业，以弥补其对在线搜索市场的非法垄断。【原文：Artificial intelligence developer Anthropic asked a federal court to nix a US government proposal that would block Alphabet Inc.’s Google from investing in artificial intelligence startups to remedy its illegal monopolization of the online search market.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利为 IT 公司卡西亚举债 40 亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，摩根士丹利正在为 Insight Partners 支持的卡西亚公司（Kaseya Inc.【原文：Morgan Stanley is sounding out investors for nearly $4 billion in leveraged loans for Insight Partners-backed Kaseya Inc. to refinance the IT management software company’s private debt, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普领导下的华盛顿正在向跃跃欲试的金融科技公司敞开大门
item.description: 在拜登时代的华盛顿，一些最大的金融科技公司一直在努力争取更多的影响力，而现在它们在国会山有了更多的机会。【原文：After struggling to win much sway in a Biden-era Washington, some of the biggest fintech firms are now getting a lot more facetime on Capitol Hill.】

item.title: 苹果承诺已久的对 Siri 的人工智能全面改造遇到错误，可能延期
item.description: 据知情人士透露，苹果公司承诺已久的对 Siri 数字助理的全面改进正面临工程问题和软件错误，有可能推迟或限制其发布。【原文：Apple Inc.’s long-promised overhaul for the Siri digital assistant is facing engineering problems and software bugs, threatening to postpone or limit its release, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 无畏的华尔街交易员拒绝因关税战而恐慌
item.description: 本周，关税、通胀和美联储的头条新闻瞬息万变，华尔街处理戏剧性事件的能力再次得到锻炼。事实再次证明，交易员们能够胜任这项任务。【原文：Wall Street’s capacity to process drama got another workout in a week of rapid-fire headlines on tariffs, inflation and the Federal Reserve. Traders proved equal to the task, once again.】

item.title: 巴菲特抛售更多美国银行股票，同时保持苹果股份不变
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway Inc. continued whittling a longtime bet on Bank of America Corp. in last year’s final months, while keeping a stake in Apple Inc. intact following an earlier reduction.】

item.title: OpenAI 董事会拒绝马斯克以 974 亿美元收购公司控制权的请求
item.description: OpenAI 董事会正式拒绝了由埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）领导的投资者集团提出的以 974 亿美元收购这家控制人工智能公司的非营利组织的提议。【原文：OpenAI’s board of directors has formally rejected an offer from a group of investors led by Elon Musk to buy the nonprofit that controls the artificial intelligence company for $97.4 billion.】

item.title: 对冲基金看涨铜的赌注达到 10 月以来最高点
item.description: 由于担心美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）可能对红色金属征收关税，资金经理们将看涨铜的赌注提高到了 10 月份以来的最高点。【原文：Money managers boosted their bullish wagers on copper to the highest since October due to concerns over potential tariffs on the red metal by US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德搬迁纽约成了卡尼的政治攻击线
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management Ltd.）决定将其总部从多伦多迁往纽约，这在一则针对马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）的新攻击广告中得到了体现，马克-卡尼正在竞选加拿大总理。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management Ltd.’s decision to shift its head office to New York from Toronto is featured in a new attack ad against Mark Carney, who’s running to become Canadian prime minister.】

item.title: 特朗普誓言为纽约人完成宪法管道工程
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普誓言要完成停滞已久的宪法管道工程，将天然气输送到纽约，并称该工程可将美国东北部各州的能源价格降低多达 70%。【原文：President Donald Trump vowed to complete the long-stalled Constitution Pipeline that would transport natural gas to New York, saying it could slash energy prices in northeastern US states by as much as 70%.】

item.title: 美联储洛根称通胀率下降不能保证降息
item.description: 达拉斯联邦储备银行行长洛里-洛根（Lorie Logan）敦促政策制定者在未来数月保持谨慎，重申通胀下降不一定会促使进一步降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Lorie Logan urged policymakers to remain cautious in the coming months, reiterating lower inflation wouldn’t necessarily prompt further interest-rate reductions.】

item.title: 爆米花品牌 LesserEvil 考虑出售价值 10 亿美元的产品
item.description: 知情人士透露，爆米花和零食品牌 LesserEvil 正在探索潜在的出售方案。【原文：Popcorn and snack brand LesserEvil is exploring a potential sale, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 机器人初创公司 Figure AI 正洽谈新一轮融资，估值达 395 亿美元
item.description:
在 OpenAI 和微软的支持下，Figure 正在讨论一轮 15 亿美元的融资。【原文：

Backed by OpenAI and Microsoft, Figure is discussing a $1.5 billion funding round. 

】

item.title: 高盛的明尼斯称，利率不确定性阻碍了并购交易
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：The long-awaited uptick in mergers and acquisitions is still being held back by uncertainty over the direction of interest rates, even as corporate borrowers have access to cheaper financing, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s global head of credit and asset finance.】

item.title: 债券落后于国债，成为 11 月以来最便宜的债券
item.description: 相对于国债而言，长期市政债券是 11 月以来最便宜的，因为美国各州和地方债务市场的投资者正面临着税收政策问题，并消化着不断膨胀的发行量。【原文：Long-maturity municipal bonds are the cheapest since November relative to Treasuries as investors in the market for US state and local debt confront questions around tax policy and absorb swelling issuance.】

item.title: 特朗普称将在 4 月 2 日前后对汽车征收新关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，他将宣布对汽车征收新的关税，这是他在寻求重塑美国贸易关系的过程中又一次大规模征收进口关税。【原文：President Donald Trump said he would unveil new tariffs on automobiles, adding to his wave of sweeping import levies as he seeks to remake US trade relationships.】
